entry.title: Free resolutions and Lefschetz properties of some Artin Gorenstein rings of codimension four
entry.summary: In 1978, Stanley constructed an example of an Artinian Gorenstein (AG) ring $A$ with non-unimodal $H$-vector $(1,13,12,13,1)$. Migliore-Zanello later showed that for regularity $r=4$, Stanley's example has the smallest possible codimension $c$ for an AG ring with non-unimodal $H$-vector. The weak Lefschetz property (WLP) has been much studied for AG rings; it is easy to show that an AG ring with non-unimodal $H$-vector fails to have WLP. In codimension $c=3$ it is conjectured that all AG rings have WLP. For $c=4$, Gondim showed that WLP always holds for $r \le 4$ and gives a family where WLP fails for any $r \ge 7$, building on an earlier example of Ikeda of failure of WLP for $r=5$. In this note we study the minimal free resolution of $A$ and relation to Lefschetz properties (both weak and strong) and Jordan type for $c=4$ and $r \le 6$.
